Message.Title: T-Mobile HTC One X to get Tegra 3+
Message.Msg: http://www.fudzilla.com/home/item/28094-t-mobile-htc-one-x-to-get-tegra-3 1.7GHz apparently HTC is reportedly working on a new One X variant for the US market. The flagship handset, codenamed HTC Era 42, is said to feature a new Tegra 3+ processor bumped up to 1.7GHz. HTC’s One X already comes in two flavours, an LTE-enabled version powered by Qualcomm’s S4 processor for the North American market and the Tegra 3 based international version. Now it seems the colonies will get a tweaked Tegra 3 as well. We still don’t know the exact specs, although the rumour mill has been abuzz with Tegra talk lately. It seems like nothing more than a 200MHz bump and we doubt it will be enough to outpace Samsung’s quad-core Exynos 4.

Topic.Title: T-Mobile HTC One X to get Tegra 3+

Message.Msg: Nice digging! Still, I don't get journalists and reviewers fascination about performance. As for mobile devices, I really don't care about chipset benchmarks. I would rather take (much) slower device with much longer battery life. And when it comes to battery life, I would say Tegra, Snapgragon, Exynos ... suck.

Topic.Title: T-Mobile HTC One X to get Tegra 3+

Message.Msg: Thx. Well regarding performance I most say i kinda hate lagginess in applications and waitings times when browsing. I would rather pay up and enjoy a premium experience. But I usually do a full day on one charge anyway. Have a nice day.

We shall see when Qualcomm APQ8064-based products become available later this year." Later this year, boys. Qualcomm captures the high-end tablet market. And kicks nvidia's Tegra 3 to the curb. So maybe those Jan. 13 nvda Puts are the perfect gift this coming Christmas. Properly wrapped, of course. -

Message.Title: September Apples: Launch of iPhone 5 and iPad mini
Message.Msg: - September Apples: Launch of the iPhone 5 and the iPad mini iPhone 5 and iPad mini both reportedly set to launch in September By: Zach Epstein | Jul 24th, 2012 at 08:40AM "A surplus of Apple (AAPL) rumors is always expected ahead of the company’s earnings reports, and the faucet is wide open on Tuesday. Apple is planning to release a smaller version of its wildly popular iPad tablet shortly after the next-generation iPhone launches this fall, one industry watcher believes. Plugged-in KGI analyst Ming-Chi Kuo, who purportedly shed some light on “iPhone 5″ specs recently, says that Apple’s next iPhone will launch in September followed closely by the release of the much-rumored “iPad mini.” “IPhone 5 to debut in September,” Ming-Chi wrote in a note to clients on Tuesday. “But due to in-cell touch panel and casing yield rate limits, ability to offset older models’ shipments decrease will be moderate.” The analyst continued, “Though shipments of iPad mini’s components will start in August, the new iPad line will end production, ready for transition to a modified New iPad line. As such, component shipments will drop in August as iPad mini’s components shipments growth will be offset.” Ming-Chi’s not that a tweaked version of Apple’s current third-generation iPad will be released around the same time mirrors earlier reports, which claimed Apple is planning some internal redesigns that address heat issues and reduce Apple’s costs. According to earlier reports, the iPad mini will be as thin as an iPod touch and will feature a 7.85-inch display and a price ranging from $249 to $299. The redesigned sixth-generation iPhone is expected to feature a 4-inch display, 4G LTE, NFC, and a redesigned case that was recently examined on video." Sounds like Really Bad News for the sale of those nvidia Tegra-powered Android devices, boys. -

Message.Title: Hacking experts find new ways to attack Android phones
Message.Msg: I'd keep my Android device off when you're not using it if I was you! http://finance.yahoo.com/news/hacking-experts-ways-attack-android-025217202.html "Accuvant researcher Charlie Miller demonstrated a method for delivering malicious code to Android phones using a new Android feature known as near field communications. "I can take over your phone," Miller said. Near field communications allow users to share photos with friends, make payments or exchange other data by bringing Android phones within a few centimeters of similarly equipped devices such as another phone or a payment terminal. Miller said he figured out how to create a device the size of a postage stamp that could be stuck in an inconspicuous place such as near a cash register at a restaurant. When an Android user walks by, the phone would get infected, said Miller. He spent five years as a global network exploit analyst at the U.S. National Security Agency, where his tasks included breaking into foreign computer systems." .... "Experts say iPhones and iPads don't face the same problem because Apple has been able to get carriers to push out security updates fairly quickly after they are released."

Topic.Title: Nexus 7 will lead Android tablets to overtake ipad

Message.Msg: I will quote one of the replies to this article... "Looks like Sameer's tablet OS predictions have now been completely torpedoed. Hot off the press: "According to the latest research from Strategy Analytics, global tablet shipments reached 25 million units in the second quarter of 2012. Apple rose to 68 percent global market share, its highest level for almost two years." The iPad has increased its marketshare from 62% a year ago to 68% this last quarter. In comparison, Android tablet shipments have plunged back to 29.3% exactly the same share they had 12 months ago. The plummeting share of Android tablets recorded in Q1 2012 has been shown to be no outlier. The iPad's marketshare has actually increased in Q2 to its highest level in almost 2 years. Got that? There is no accelerating smartphone Android marketshare land grab in the tablet world even despite all the latest iPad-killers. The Kindle Fire was a flash in the pan and it is highly likely the Nexus 7 will be similar, competing as it does against the lower cost iPad 2, the iPod touch and the rumours of smaller screen iPads and larger screen iPod touches."

Topic.Title: Nexus 7 will lead Android tablets to overtake ipad
